data.title: Comment: Michael Portillo: Remember, everyone is a 'bloody foreigner' somewhere
data.meta_description: She winced slightly as she remembered that I am an immigrant’s son. Despite that background I have managed to make my way in life without being a burden on the British taxpayer, although I certainly
data.text:
She winced slightly as she remembered that I am an immigrant’s son. Despite that background I have managed to make my way in life without being a burden on the British taxpayer, although I certainly did get a wonderful start from this country’s state-funded education system. Michael Howard, with two immigrant parents, has of course got by pretty well, too.

When I was first returned to parliament someone wrote me a somewhat xenophobic letter. Britain had recently been at war with Argentina and I think my name aroused the writer’s suspicions. “You cannot imagine,” he wrote, “how much I resent it that a foreigner like you has been elected.”

Then there was an unexpected change in his tone: “If in fact this is part of
